Sentencas: In this study, scandia-stabilized zirconia (ScSZ) electrolyte thin-film layers were deposited via chemical solution deposition (CSD).
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: We selected 10ScSZ (10% Sc2O3, 90% ZrO2 molar ratio) as the target material, and the precursor solution was prepared by precise calculations.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: The 10ScSZ solution was deposited on Al2O3 substrate using a spin-coating method.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: Then, the substrate was sintered using two methods: flash light irradiation and thermal.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: The characteristics of the thin films were compared, including ionic conductivity, surface morphology, and chemical composition.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: Pulsed light sintering was applied in the sintering step under a variety of energy density conditions from 80 to 130 J/cm2, irradiation on/off times of 10 ms and 10 ms/500 ms, number of pulses, and bottom heat from 300 to 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: The ionic conductivity of the ScSZ electrolyte layers fabricated by thermal or flash light irradiation methods was tested and compared.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation

Sentencas: The results show that the ScSZ electrolyte layer sintered by flash light irradiation within a few seconds of process time had similar ionic conductivity to the electrolyte layer that was thermal sintered for about 10 h including cooling process.
Titulo: Fabrication of Scandia-Stabilized Zirconia Thin Films by Instant Flash Light Irradiation
